NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the unlawful use of violence, especially bombing, kidnapping, and assassination, carried out for political purposes 恐怖主义，恐怖行动
think deeply about, remind oneself of (past events) 思考；反思
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We agree that a central purpose of drama has always been to provide a means for a society to reflect upon itself and its beliefs.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  潜意识    a. lacking awareness and the capacity for sensory perception; not conscious 无意识的；未发觉的；不省人事的
transmit (printed matter or an image) by electronic means 传真
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Traveling businesspeople can send and receive electronic mail and fax messages in some airports.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v.  extend across in space or time 横跨，横越   n.  跨度，期间
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Travelers will be able to walk across a footbridge that spans the Huangpu River by 2010.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. not disturbed; calm 未受干扰的；安静的，镇定
a. 庄严的，堂皇的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. the stately Temple of Heaven

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  纽约人
v.  run slowly for physical exercise; push slightly 慢跑；轻推  n.
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Peter jogged my arm and made me spill my tea.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 脚踏车，自行车
v.  go for a long walk 远足，徒步旅行   n.
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We are planning to hike in the country on Sunday.

NewWords.WordPhrase: without payment, free; with no reward or result 免费；无酬劳，徒劳
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I know the cyber bar manager, so I always get in for nothing.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  maintaining or being maintained 维护，保养
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Concrete pavements have a long life and require little maintenance.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  有篷小型（客）货车；先锋
n.  眉毛
v. struggle or compete 斗争，竞争
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Several teams are contending for the prize.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  不赞成的，反对的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. When I showed my newly-bought suit to her, she cast a disapproving look at it.

NewWords.WordPhrase: put (sb./sth.) forward as an example, show 将…视为范例
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This school is being held up as a model for other middle schools in the city.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  to the point; related 中肯的；有关的，相干的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If you intend to be a teacher, you have to obtain knowledge and skills pertinent to classroom teaching.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 重击，冲击力   vt. 猛击，击溃
n. 新娘
n.  痛苦，不幸
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Euthanasia is a practice of mercifully ending a person's life in order to release the person from an incurable disease and intolerable suffering.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  种族混合的，不同种族间的
n.  未婚妻
accept (sth. that is seen as not quite satisfactory) 勉强接受，勉强认可
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I would like a job in banking, but jobs are so scarce at the moment I would settle for anything.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be produced or published; become known, be revealed 发表，出版；公开，透露
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The dictionary has just come out on CD-ROM.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 身份证   vt. 给…发身份证
n. 标签，附加物   vt. 加标签于，紧随
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Staff were required to wear name tags at work.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. thin cord; a series of things put together on a thread 细绳，线；一串，一行   vt.（用绳、线）悬挂，系住
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The parcel was tied up with string.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 铝
v. think about carefully and for a long time 沉思，考虑
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I found myself constantly pondering the question: "What's the meaning of life?"

NewWords.WordPhrase: suddenly 突然
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. All the kids were quietly asleep, when, all of a sudden, the bell rang.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  吊裤带
n. 付薪水的支票；薪水
a. not easily seen or understood; not well-known 不易看清的；费解的，朦胧的；不出名的   vt. 使暗，使模糊
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The letter is written in rather obscure language.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n., v. 繁荣，迅速发展
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. As workers born during the baby boom of 1946-1964 have aged, the work force in the United States has grown progressively older.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  the state of being unable to live for ever; the rate of deaths among a certain kind of people 必死性；死亡率
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The nation's infant mortality rate has reached a record low.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. (infml) = no
a. 道听途说的，趣闻轶事的
a.  统计的，统计学的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The teacher made a statistical analysis of how frequently certain words are used in speech and writing.

NewWords.WordPhrase: support; make a copy of (a disk, a file, etc.) 支持，复制…作为备份
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Only a few employees backed him up in the election.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n., a. 婴儿（的），幼儿（的）
n. 兜；（自行车等）行李架；搬运工具；运送者；航空母舰
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Your carrier for this flight is British Airways.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  折叠式婴儿手推车；散步者，闲逛者
n.  （电影或电视的）片段，镜头
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The film contained some old newsreel footage.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt.  enclose with a covering 包住，覆盖，包围
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Walking in the forest, we felt the rich fragrant smell of the forest enveloping us.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. 恶魔（般）的
n. 治疗专家
n. a young person between childhood and adulthood 青少年   a. 青春期的，青春
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Historically, the task of instructing adolescents about sex has been seen as the responsibility of the parents.

NewWords.WordPhrase: send (sth.) to a place where it will be dealt with 寄送，呈交
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Applicants were asked to send in a CV and a covering letter.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. happen again or repeatedly 复发，反复出现
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Although he was not caught cheating on the exam, the feelings of guilt recurred over and over again.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. not usual, exceptional 不寻常的，与众不同的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A profusion of Japanese cherry trees is an unusual feature of the garden.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. (wove, woven) 编，织，编排   n. 编法，织法，编织式样
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. In The Emperor's New Clothes, the two strangers declare they can weave the finest stuff anyone can imagine.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. the ability to imagine; sth. only imagined and not real 想象（力）；想象出来的东西
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Einstein's genius was characterized equally by logical clarity and creative imagination.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  free from control 无拘无束的，自由自在的
